content.description: Center climb up the middle of the right slab.
This slab curves a bit to the right, starting under the boulder on the ridge and ending up at the anchor set just to the right of it.
content.protection: There are adjacent cracks for nuts, and a hanger bolted about 30' up. Chain anchors, and you can walk up from for some TR action.
content.location: This is the leftmost slab when you're facing RotoWall, up a little hill from the other bolted climb.

content.description: The leftmost route on the right portion of the crag.
It is right to the roto route. This is easy cracks and blocky rock. there is a tree in the middle
content.protection: Has anchor bolts in the top. which can be top roped by climbing through the side - doesn't have an easy trail, but a scramble, may be class 4 (couple of moves). Rappel Route is through the Slip n slide route. ONLY 1 rap chains for the entire roto wall
content.location:
Roto Wall.

Far left is the Roto Route, you will notice the obvious cracks and blocky stuff in the middle and a tree. This route is not mentioned in any guide books, but there are anchor bolts in the top, that can be top roped or climbed using trad gear.

content.description: Follow zig-zagging cracks and rock wrinkles to bolted anchors.  Crux is near the top.  Two bolts protect where there is no crack.
content.protection: Finger sized cams and nuts, 2 bolts on lower face. Bolted anchor with chains at the top.
content.location: There are no chains or rap rings, but you can walk over to adjacent chained anchors of Non-Vertical Smile/Slippin' n' Slidin' to rap down.
